asked Donald Rumsfeld why, in 2001, after the invasion of Afghanistan, the U.S. didn't deploy more of its troops to close Osama bin Laden 's escape route from Tora Bora, instead of relying on Afghan forces. INSKEEP: You make a valid point when you say you want to leave decisions to the commander on the ground. And you say the commander on the ground made the decision that it was better to proceed with Afghans. RUMSFELD: Now, wait a second. There were not just Afghans. There were American forces involved. Announcing financial results for the quarter ended September 30, 2010.
